alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 3:30AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to o0.5 inches possible. * WHERE...Central Willamette Valley and South Willamette Valley. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will likely begin Friday evening in the central Willamette Valley but will likely not accumulate on surfaces until later Friday night. Freezing rain may begin Friday night in the southern Willamette Valley continuing through Saturday. Currently, the main precipitation type appears to be snow for the central Willamette Valley and freezing rain for the southern Willamette Valley. However, uncertainty remains high regarding exact snow and ice amounts.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; South Willamette Valley
